posts.post_content:
Bring out all the creatures that you can in one turn, then follow up with a [Twilight Shepherd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight Shepherd). You get back all the creatures but the Shepherd, who stays in play because of Persist.  
OR you could use your [Erratic Portal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Erratic Portal ) to pull back your creature to use again next turn. Great to combo with [Bogardan Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bogardan Hellkite).

posts.post_content:
For extra props, before attacking equip [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) :)  
  
But no seriously, I'm liking Sundial of the Infinite and Living Death, and to me the perfect followup card to those are: Kaalia of the Vast!  
  
:p Yeah. So maybe it's slightly unimaginative. Frankly Kaalia of the Vast is the most epic creature they have ever made. Very high power, but in a more restrained way than Emrakul or Progenitus- actually a fun/interactive card :D  
  
And putting out 2 or 3 hasty Flying Beatsticks a turn just feels great.  
  
AND Black+White gives you all the return-to-battlefield effects you could ever want!  
  
It's like, every day, EVERY STINKING DAY, I find something that's broken with Kaalia. And don't think that being Blue or Green makes a card 'safe'. Scion of the Ur-Dragon as General. Maelstrom Archangel just because you can. Yeah.   
  
I have officially become as obsessed about Kaalia as people were about Jace. Kaalia doesn't cost $100 though, so I should start collecting playsets :)
posts.html:
For extra props, before attacking equip Whispersilk Cloak :)

But no seriously, I'm liking Sundial of the Infinite and Living Death, and to me the perfect followup card to those are: Kaalia of the Vast!

:p Yeah. So maybe it's slightly unimaginative. Frankly Kaalia of the Vast is the most epic creature they have ever made. Very high power, but in a more restrained way than Emrakul or Progenitus- actually a fun/interactive card :D

And putting out 2 or 3 hasty Flying Beatsticks a turn just feels great.

AND Black+White gives you all the return-to-battlefield effects you could ever want!

It's like, every day, EVERY STINKING DAY, I find something that's broken with Kaalia. And don't think that being Blue or Green makes a card 'safe'. Scion of the Ur-Dragon as General. Maelstrom Archangel just because you can. Yeah.

I have officially become as obsessed about Kaalia as people were about Jace. Kaalia doesn't cost $100 though, so I should start collecting playsets :)

posts.post_content: One of my favorite cards in the entire game. They don't make them like this anymore kids. Entire deck types based around cards from this block. it was one of the best ever.
